It felt like a huge deal then, and honestly, it still does.

unnormalised: The latest update is that the deadline to link your PAN card with your Aadhaar is fast approaching. I think it's the 30/06/2024, if I'm not mistaken. Failing to do so could mean your PAN becomes inoperative. Imagine the hassle! No filing ITR, no big transactions... basically, a whole load of financial headaches. My CA told me a few days ago to better prepone all my fillings. I'm always late to these things; it's a disaster!

unnormalised: And speaking of important IDs, there's also the matter of updating your driving license details. Seems like a small thing, but if the address on your DL doesn't match your current one, you could run into problems, especially with things like insurance claims or even just traffic stops. Remember Mr. Sharma from my mohalla? He had to run around for days to get his DL updated after moving.

unnormalised: The Election Commission is also running campaigns to get people to update their Voter ID cards, or EPIC as they call them. Making sure your name and address are correctly registered is super important, especially with elections around the corner. You don’t want to be turned away from the polling booth on election day, right? My EPIC number is something like ABC1234567, and I always double-check it before voting.

unnormalised: Then there’s the whole DigiLocker thing. I know, another app, another password. But seriously, it’s a lifesaver! I keep digital copies of my Aadhaar, PAN, DL, even my 10th-grade marksheet there. It’s so much easier than carrying around physical copies of everything. I can just flash my phone when they ask for any doc.

It might seem like a chore, but it's a small price to pay for avoiding a lot of unnecessary problems down the line. Don't be like my neighbour, always running around in the last minute! Do it ASAP.

unnormalised: Basically, keeping on top of your IDs is a boring but necessary part of adulting in India today.
